intro: Salsola planistigma, commonly known as desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is a low-growing shrub or perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features small, pale green or grayish leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in harsh environments. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits known as胞果. Salsola planistigma is often found in sandy soils and is capable of surviving in extreme temperatures and low moisture conditions.
